June 29, 2019 at 11:43 PM ·

From Aiden Veress:
This photo shows the Kumamoto Castle in Kumamoto City. The castle was built by a daimyo named Kato Kiyomasa in the 16th century to defend the nearby regions. The castle was never overrun throughout the feudal period and was left I disturbed until the 19th century when fire overran the castle, burning most of its structures. The castle was reconstructed in 1960 using concrete and remained as a popular tourist attraction until 2016 when the castle was partially collapsed by the Kumamoto earthquake. Renovations to repair the earthquake damage are currently ongoing. #KakehashiAward

The students competing were Will Dalin, Josie Thomas, Alexis McDonald, Chase Cunningham, Tyler Koel, and Keena Lewis.

Good luck on Tuesday Jan. 24th at the South West FFA District Ag Sales competition in Livingston!

Tuesday morning, 1/10, the Joint Subcommittee on Education defined a new starting point for state funding for public schools in Montana. The Governor's proposed budget started with a $21M decrease in state funding to schools. The Joint Subcommittee added about $3M to that amount to reach the $24M level noted in an article in the Chronicle today.

What does that mean for Gardiner it is approved:

Gardiner overall would lose about $42,000 in state funding.
